gold.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a valuable soft yellow metal that is used to make coins, jewellery etc. It is a chemical element: symbol Au
9/18/22/24 carat gold (=a measurement used to show how pure gold is)
gold.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: coins, jewellery etc made of gold
gold.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: She came to the party dripping with gold  (=wearing a lot of gold).
gold.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: The room was decorated in golds and blues.
Gold looks good on people with dark hair.
gold.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: a valuable soft metal used to make jewellery, coins etc, and formerly used in a system in which the value of the standard unit of a currency is equal to a fixed weight of gold of a particular quality
gold.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: On the Commodity Exchange in New York, gold for current delivery settled at $394 an ounce, up $8.60.

gold.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: to make a useful or valuable discovery that will make a lot of money
